main event: Three white, brightly lighted, green flashing lights in close formation were observed in Shreveport, Louisiana on November 6, 1957.
interesting points: One of the lights seemed to be towing an object.
One light went north, one went south, and one disappeared.
The report states that everything in the description points to the lights being radar reports and other military aircraft in error.
The report includes detailed tracking data for multiple aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: Three white, brightly lighted, green flashing lights in close formation
photographs: No photographs included in the report
